topics.body:
So apparently general relativity and everything you know is wrong. . . *LITERALLY*

In 2012 physicist Joseph Polchinski theorized that a blackhole is literally a rip in space and all destroyed matter and spat it back out in the universe; this doesn't just wreck with our basic understanding of physics, but outright slips physics a mickey and has it's way with it.  Why?  Cause essentially what this means is that inside a black hole you literally hit the end of the universe.  Basically Einsteing may be wrong.  However Steven Hawking theorized that there is no such thing as a black hole at all; rather all a black hole is a bunch of mass in a extremely small space with a "apparent horizon".  This still massively screws with relativity though.

Tl:dr; everything you know is wrong.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@Number1pegasus":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/540e7e176368722958440000#post_540e7e176368722958440000
No; our basic understanding of physics is wrong meaning there is a high probability everything you know about how things work is wrong cause general relativity may be wrong.

If a black hole is the end of the universe everything you know is wrong.
If a black hole doesn't have a actual event horizon(point of no return essentially) everything you know is still wrong.
If einstein was right then everything you know is still wrong cause of "quantum entanglement".
